list.name: Changes
list.comment:
stabilize marker rendering; unify quota to 10; always decrement per report; branding & UX polish; harden backend
- Keep properties visible at all zoom levels; prevent debounce wipes - Normalize payload handling in `fetch_homes` (dict/list) and caching - Reintroduce localized “Analyzing…” splash during report generation - Set initial quota to **10** for all users; migrate existing users to **10/10** - Count **every** generated report (cached or fresh) as **-1** quota - Remove legacy `used.json` logic to avoid double-counting & I/O - Add © 2025 REintelligence.app to bottom bar and report footer (EN/ES) - Update dev test hint to “(10 reports)” - Repair multiple backend syntax issues (f-strings, try/except, cache helpers) - Fix disk cache load order and import `timedelta`

component.name: FlaskConsoleOptions

option.name: myCustomStartScript

task.summary:
feat(auth,quota,ui): add login/register modal, per-user quotas, and robust bottom bar; remove legacy root counters; harden client flow
- Add login/register splash modal; require auth when session missing/expired or quota == 0 - Implement per-user storage under users/<username>/: - password.txt - quota.json (count/max) - used.json (dedupe report charges) - Add endpoints: /auth/status, /auth/login, /auth/register, /auth/logout - Make /counter user-aware: {is_logged_in, user, count, max}; keep count/max for backward compat - Guard /clicked via before_request: - 403 auth_required when not logged in - 403 quota_exhausted when quota == 0 - Client: pre-check /auth/status before calling /clicked; on 403, open modal or show quota message - Bottom bar: - Logged in: "username — count/max — Logout" - Guest: "Guest - Login/Register" (no quota) - Remove functional use of root report_counter.json/report_counter_used.json; consume per-user quota only - Fix JS syntax errors by consolidating scripts into a single inline block; remove code embedded in <script src="..."> - Sanitize report HTML (strip code fences); improve popup styling and mobile responsiveness - Add dev user rey / R34n3l.2025 (quota=5) - Preserve all existing routes and functionality; changes are additive and non-breaking

feat(auth,quota,ui): add login/register modal, per-user quotas, and robust bottom bar; remove legacy root counters; harden client flow
- Add login/register splash modal; require auth when session missing/expired or quota == 0 - Implement per-user storage under users/<username>/: - password.txt - quota.json (count/max) - used.json (dedupe report charges) - Add endpoints: /auth/status, /auth/login, /auth/register, /auth/logout - Make /counter user-aware: {is_logged_in, user, count, max}; keep count/max for backward compat - Guard /clicked via before_request: - 403 auth_required when not logged in - 403 quota_exhausted when quota == 0 - Client: pre-check /auth/status before calling /clicked; on 403, open modal or show quota message - Bottom bar: - Logged in: "username — count/max — Logout" - Guest: "Guest - Login/Register" (no quota) - Remove functional use of root report_counter.json/report_counter_used.json; consume per-user quota only - Fix JS syntax errors by consolidating scripts into a single inline block; remove code embedded in <script src="..."> - Sanitize report HTML (strip code fences); improve popup styling and mobile responsiveness - Add dev user rey / R34n3l.2025 (quota=5) - Preserve all existing routes and functionality; changes are additive and non-breaking

feat(auth,quota,ui): add login/register modal, per-user quotas, and robust bottom bar; remove legacy root counters; harden client flow
- Add login/register splash modal; require auth when session missing/expired or quota == 0 - Implement per-user storage under users/<username>/: - password.txt - quota.json (count/max) - used.json (dedupe report charges) - Add endpoints: /auth/status, /auth/login, /auth/register, /auth/logout - Make /counter user-aware: {is_logged_in, user, count, max}; keep count/max for backward compat - Guard /clicked via before_request: - 403 auth_required when not logged in - 403 quota_exhausted when quota == 0 - Client: pre-check /auth/status before calling /clicked; on 403, open modal or show quota message - Bottom bar: - Logged in: "username — count/max — Logout" - Guest: "Guest - Login/Register" (no quota) - Remove functional use of root report_counter.json/report_counter_used.json; consume per-user quota only - Fix JS syntax errors by consolidating scripts into a single inline block; remove code embedded in <script src="..."> - Sanitize report HTML (strip code fences); improve popup styling and mobile responsiveness - Add dev user rey / R34n3l.2025 (quota=5) - Preserve all existing routes and functionality; changes are additive and non-breaking

feat(auth,quota,ui): add login/register modal, per-user quotas, and robust bottom bar; remove legacy root counters; harden client flow
- Add login/register splash modal; require auth when session missing/expired or quota == 0 - Implement per-user storage under users/<username>/: - password.txt - quota.json (count/max) - used.json (dedupe report charges) - Add endpoints: /auth/status, /auth/login, /auth/register, /auth/logout - Make /counter user-aware: {is_logged_in, user, count, max}; keep count/max for backward compat - Guard /clicked via before_request: - 403 auth_required when not logged in - 403 quota_exhausted when quota == 0 - Client: pre-check /auth/status before calling /clicked; on 403, open modal or show quota message - Bottom bar: - Logged in: "username — count/max — Logout" - Guest: "Guest - Login/Register" (no quota) - Remove functional use of root report_counter.json/report_counter_used.json; consume per-user quota only - Fix JS syntax errors by consolidating scripts into a single inline block; remove code embedded in <script src="..."> - Sanitize report HTML (strip code fences); improve popup styling and mobile responsiveness - Add dev user rey / R34n3l.2025 (quota=5) - Preserve all existing routes and functionality; changes are additive and non-breaking Restored a single, switchable auth splash (Login ↔ Register) with the full HTML markup:
#auth-overlay and #auth-modal
Username/password inputs
Submit button (label changes with mode)
Bottom toggle (“Don’t have an account? Register” / “Already have an account? Login”)
Added the JS for:
openAuthModal, closeAuthModal, switchAuthTab, setAuthError, submitAuth
A document-level click handler that opens the modal when you click Guest – Login/Register in the bottom bar.
Kept the immediate bottom bar update after successful login/register, and confirm via /auth/status.

Added a clean “×” close icon in the auth modal’s top-right (clicking it closes the modal).
Wired EN/ES localizations for:
Bottom-bar link: Login/Register → Iniciar/Registrarse
Modal title & submit: Login / Register → Iniciar sesión / Registrarse
Toggle text:
Don’t have an account? Register → ¿No tienes cuenta? Registrarse
Already have an account? Login → ¿Ya tienes cuenta? Iniciar sesión
Logout link: Logout → Cerrar sesión
The strings are merged into the I18N object and picked based on currentLanguage (falls back to English if undefined).
Repaired the modal markup: there was a stray \1 placeholder where <div id="auth-modal"> should be, so document.getElementById('auth-modal') returned null and .style crashed. I inserted a proper <div id="auth-modal" …> wrapper right after #auth-overlay.
Hardened the JS:
openAuthModal() now calls ensureAuthModal() first and guards nulls before touching .style.
closeAuthModal() now also guards gracefully.

feat(auth): implement frontend logout handler
- Add window.authLogout() in base.html: - POST /auth/logout with credentials - Optimistic UI update to Guest; call refreshCounterBar() to confirm - Leave backend /auth/logout as-is (already implemented) - Add window.authLogout(): POST /auth/logout, optimistically render Guest, refresh /auth/status - Add closeReportOverlay(); allow clicking the dim background to close report - Scope i18n updates to report popup only (#floating-gpt-popup) for print/close labels - Remove .gpt-popup-print-btn from auth modal submit; use .auth-primary-btn instead - Use .gpt-popup-btns on report header for correct sticky styling

feat(auth): implement frontend logout handler
- Add window.authLogout() in base.html: - POST /auth/logout with credentials - Optimistic UI update to Guest; call refreshCounterBar() to confirm - Leave backend /auth/logout as-is (already implemented) - Add window.authLogout(): POST /auth/logout, optimistically render Guest, refresh /auth/status - Add closeReportOverlay(); allow clicking the dim background to close report - Scope i18n updates to report popup only (#floating-gpt-popup) for print/close labels - Remove .gpt-popup-print-btn from auth modal submit; use .auth-primary-btn instead - Use .gpt-popup-btns on report header for correct sticky styling

implement frontend logout handler
- Add window.authLogout() in base.html: - POST /auth/logout with credentials - Optimistic UI update to Guest; call refreshCounterBar() to confirm - Leave backend /auth/logout as-is (already implemented) - Add window.authLogout(): POST /auth/logout, optimistically render Guest, refresh /auth/status - Add closeReportOverlay(); allow clicking the dim background to close report - Scope i18n updates to report popup only (#floating-gpt-popup) for print/close labels - Remove .gpt-popup-print-btn from auth modal submit; use .auth-primary-btn instead - Use .gpt-popup-btns on report header for correct sticky styling

implement frontend logout handler
- Add window.authLogout() in base.html: - POST /auth/logout with credentials - Optimistic UI update to Guest; call refreshCounterBar() to confirm - Leave backend /auth/logout as-is (already implemented) - Add window.authLogout(): POST /auth/logout, optimistically render Guest, refresh /auth/status - Add closeReportOverlay(); allow clicking the dim background to close report - Scope i18n updates to report popup only (#floating-gpt-popup) for print/close labels - Remove .gpt-popup-print-btn from auth modal submit; use .auth-primary-btn instead - Use .gpt-popup-btns on report header for correct sticky styling Blank screen fixed. Your previous file had two blockers:
A stray literal \1 right after <html lang="en"> (from a regex backreference) that confused parsing.
Critical functions like applyLang(), createLeafletMap(), updateHouseIcons(), and setupMapRefresh() were missing, so the map never initialized and i18n couldn’t run.
I rebuilt base.html cleanly with:
Proper <head> tag and a tiny data-URL favicon (no more 404).
Full EN/ES i18n dictionary + getI18n(), applyLang(), and toggleLanguage() wired so the property preview popup switches language instantly.
Complete Leaflet setup (createLeafletMap, layers control, refresh loop, marker rendering).
The “Good deal?” flow with report popup (print/close localized).
Limit-reached modal (centered, styled, localized).
Single, clean quota bar + auth wiring (Login/Register ↔ Logout works, localized).

full EN/ES localization, stable logout, centered limit modal, quota bar cleanup, live language toggle; expand modals; redirect buy/upgrade to root; enlarge popup image; fix parsing errors
- i18n: Add comprehensive EN/ES strings (auth modal, limit modal, property popup, quota bar, Leaflet layers) - i18n: Map backend `user_exists` → localized message - auth: Optimistic logout + POST /auth/logout + /auth/status revalidate; show Guest instantly - ui(quota): Replace fragmented logic with a single clean IIFE; ensure blue styling; refresh on lang toggle - ui(limit): Replace browser alert with centered modal; increase padding/line-height/min-height - ui(auth): Beautify & expand modal to fit content; keep buttons consistent with GUI - ui(popup): Increase property image to 280px; ensure Close/Print localized - lang toggle: Rebuild property popup + relabel “Good deal?” buttons + update quota bar labels immediately - nav: Change /upgrade and /buy actions to redirect to root (/) - fix: Remove stray tokens/extra braces/dangling catch blocks causing blank screen and missing functions - chore: Add data-URL favicon to silence 404

full EN/ES localization, stable logout, centered limit modal, quota bar cleanup, live language toggle; expand modals; redirect buy/upgrade to root; enlarge popup image; fix parsing errors
- i18n: Add comprehensive EN/ES strings (auth modal, limit modal, property popup, quota bar, Leaflet layers) - i18n: Map backend `user_exists` → localized message - auth: Optimistic logout + POST /auth/logout + /auth/status revalidate; show Guest instantly - ui(quota): Replace fragmented logic with a single clean IIFE; ensure blue styling; refresh on lang toggle - ui(limit): Replace browser alert with centered modal; increase padding/line-height/min-height - ui(auth): Beautify & expand modal to fit content; keep buttons consistent with GUI - ui(popup): Increase property image to 280px; ensure Close/Print localized - lang toggle: Rebuild property popup + relabel “Good deal?” buttons + update quota bar labels immediately - nav: Change /upgrade and /buy actions to redirect to root (/) - fix: Remove stray tokens/extra braces/dangling catch blocks causing blank screen and missing functions - chore: Add data-URL favicon to silence 404

stabilize marker rendering; unify quota to 10; always decrement per report; branding & UX polish; harden backend
- Keep properties visible at all zoom levels; prevent debounce wipes - Normalize payload handling in `fetch_homes` (dict/list) and caching - Reintroduce localized “Analyzing…” splash during report generation - Set initial quota to **10** for all users; migrate existing users to **10/10** - Count **every** generated report (cached or fresh) as **-1** quota - Remove legacy `used.json` logic to avoid double-counting & I/O - Add © 2025 REintelligence.app to bottom bar and report footer (EN/ES) - Update dev test hint to “(10 reports)” - Repair multiple backend syntax issues (f-strings, try/except, cache helpers) - Fix disk cache load order and import `timedelta`

feat(auth,quota,ui): add login/register modal, per-user quotas, and robust bottom bar; remove legacy root counters; harden client flow
- Add login/register splash modal; require auth when session missing/expired or quota == 0 - Implement per-user storage under users/<username>/: - password.txt - quota.json (count/max) - used.json (dedupe report charges) - Add endpoints: /auth/status, /auth/login, /auth/register, /auth/logout - Make /counter user-aware: {is_logged_in, user, count, max}; keep count/max for backward compat - Guard /clicked via before_request: - 403 auth_required when not logged in - 403 quota_exhausted when quota == 0 - Client: pre-check /auth/status before calling /clicked; on 403, open modal or show quota message - Bottom bar: - Logged in: "username — count/max — Logout" - Guest: "Guest - Login/Register" (no quota) - Remove functional use of root report_counter.json/report_counter_used.json; consume per-user quota only - Fix JS syntax errors by consolidating scripts into a single inline block; remove code embedded in <script src="..."> - Sanitize report HTML (strip code fences); improve popup styling and mobile responsiveness - Add dev user rey / R34n3l.2025 (quota=5) - Preserve all existing routes and functionality; changes are additive and non-breaking

- Add login/register splash modal; require auth when session missing/expired or quota == 0 - Implement per-user storage under users/<username>/: - password.txt - quota.json (count/max) - used.json (dedupe report charges) - Add endpoints: /auth/status, /auth/login, /auth/register, /auth/logout - Make /counter user-aware: {is_logged_in, user, count, max}; keep count/max for backward compat - Guard /clicked via before_request: - 403 auth_required when not logged in - 403 quota_exhausted when quota == 0 - Client: pre-check /auth/status before calling /clicked; on 403, open modal or show quota message - Bottom bar: - Logged in: "username — count/max — Logout" - Guest: "Guest - Login/Register" (no quota) - Remove functional use of root report_counter.json/report_counter_used.json; consume per-user quota only - Fix JS syntax errors by consolidating scripts into a single inline block; remove code embedded in <script src="..."> - Sanitize report HTML (strip code fences); improve popup styling and mobile responsiveness - Add dev user rey / R34n3l.2025 (quota=5) - Preserve all existing routes and functionality; changes are additive and non-breaking Restored a single, switchable auth splash (Login ↔ Register) with the full HTML markup:
#auth-overlay and #auth-modal
Username/password inputs
Submit button (label changes with mode)
Bottom toggle (“Don’t have an account? Register” / “Already have an account? Login”)
Added the JS for:
openAuthModal, closeAuthModal, switchAuthTab, setAuthError, submitAuth
A document-level click handler that opens the modal when you click Guest – Login/Register in the bottom bar.
Kept the immediate bottom bar update after successful login/register, and confirm via /auth/status.

Added a clean “×” close icon in the auth modal’s top-right (clicking it closes the modal).
Wired EN/ES localizations for:
Bottom-bar link: Login/Register → Iniciar/Registrarse
Modal title & submit: Login / Register → Iniciar sesión / Registrarse
Toggle text:
Don’t have an account? Register → ¿No tienes cuenta? Registrarse
Already have an account? Login → ¿Ya tienes cuenta? Iniciar sesión
Logout link: Logout → Cerrar sesión
The strings are merged into the I18N object and picked based on currentLanguage (falls back to English if undefined).
Repaired the modal markup: there was a stray \1 placeholder where <div id="auth-modal"> should be, so document.getElementById('auth-modal') returned null and .style crashed. I inserted a proper <div id="auth-modal" …> wrapper right after #auth-overlay.
Hardened the JS:
openAuthModal() now calls ensureAuthModal() first and guards nulls before touching .style.
closeAuthModal() now also guards gracefully.

- Add window.authLogout() in base.html: - POST /auth/logout with credentials - Optimistic UI update to Guest; call refreshCounterBar() to confirm - Leave backend /auth/logout as-is (already implemented) - Add window.authLogout(): POST /auth/logout, optimistically render Guest, refresh /auth/status - Add closeReportOverlay(); allow clicking the dim background to close report - Scope i18n updates to report popup only (#floating-gpt-popup) for print/close labels - Remove .gpt-popup-print-btn from auth modal submit; use .auth-primary-btn instead - Use .gpt-popup-btns on report header for correct sticky styling

- Add window.authLogout() in base.html: - POST /auth/logout with credentials - Optimistic UI update to Guest; call refreshCounterBar() to confirm - Leave backend /auth/logout as-is (already implemented) - Add window.authLogout(): POST /auth/logout, optimistically render Guest, refresh /auth/status - Add closeReportOverlay(); allow clicking the dim background to close report - Scope i18n updates to report popup only (#floating-gpt-popup) for print/close labels - Remove .gpt-popup-print-btn from auth modal submit; use .auth-primary-btn instead - Use .gpt-popup-btns on report header for correct sticky styling

- Add window.authLogout() in base.html: - POST /auth/logout with credentials - Optimistic UI update to Guest; call refreshCounterBar() to confirm - Leave backend /auth/logout as-is (already implemented) - Add window.authLogout(): POST /auth/logout, optimistically render Guest, refresh /auth/status - Add closeReportOverlay(); allow clicking the dim background to close report - Scope i18n updates to report popup only (#floating-gpt-popup) for print/close labels - Remove .gpt-popup-print-btn from auth modal submit; use .auth-primary-btn instead - Use .gpt-popup-btns on report header for correct sticky styling Blank screen fixed. Your previous file had two blockers:
A stray literal \1 right after <html lang="en"> (from a regex backreference) that confused parsing.
Critical functions like applyLang(), createLeafletMap(), updateHouseIcons(), and setupMapRefresh() were missing, so the map never initialized and i18n couldn’t run.
I rebuilt base.html cleanly with:
Proper <head> tag and a tiny data-URL favicon (no more 404).

Complete Leaflet setup (createLeafletMap, layers control, refresh loop, marker rendering).

Single, clean quota bar + auth wiring (Login/Register ↔ Logout works, localized).

- Keep properties visible at all zoom levels; prevent debounce wipes - Normalize payload handling in `fetch_homes` (dict/list) and caching - Reintroduce localized “Analyzing…” splash during report generation - Set initial quota to **10** for all users; migrate existing users to **10/10** - Count **every** generated report (cached or fresh) as **-1** quota - Remove legacy `used.json` logic to avoid double-counting & I/O - Add © 2025 REintelligence.app to bottom bar and report footer (EN/ES) - Update dev test hint to “(10 reports)” - Repair multiple backend syntax issues (f-strings, try/except, cache helpers) - Fix disk cache load order and import `timedelta`

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
stabilize marker rendering; unify quota to 10; always decrement per report; branding & UX polish; harden backend
- Keep properties visible at all zoom levels; prevent debounce wipes - Normalize payload handling in `fetch_homes` (dict/list) and caching - Reintroduce localized “Analyzing…” splash during report generation - Set initial quota to **10** for all users; migrate existing users to **10/10** - Count **every** generated report (cached or fresh) as **-1** quota - Remove legacy `used.json` logic to avoid double-counting & I/O - Add © 2025 REintelligence.app to bottom bar and report footer (EN/ES) - Update dev test hint to “(10 reports)” - Repair multiple backend syntax issues (f-strings, try/except, cache helpers) - Fix disk cache load order and import `timedelta`
